title: Exploring the Potential of SSL Models for Sound Event Detection
author: Hanfang Cui (Shanghai Normal University), Longfei Song (Shanghai Normal University), Li Li (Shanghai Normal University), Dongxing Xu (Unisound AI Technology Co., Ltd.), Yanhua Long (Shanghai Normal University), ...
relevance_why: The integration of self-supervised learning (SSL) models and the proposed framework for sound event detection can enhance audio applications in Haohe Liu's research, particularly in audio generation and quality enhancement tasks.
background: Sound event detection involves identifying and localizing specific acoustic events within audio recordings, a key challenge in audio analysis.
contribution: This paper introduces a framework combining various self-supervised learning models to enhance sound event detection, achieving improved detection accuracy and robustness.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods often focused on a single self-supervised learning model, limiting their representational power and performance in dynamic environments.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by integrating multiple SSL models and proposing a post-processing method, leading to complementary performance gains in sound event detection.

key_innovation: The proposed framework for model fusion leverages diverse SSL representations, enhancing detection capabilities and adaptability to different acoustic conditions.
real_world_impact: This study could significantly improve applications in smart environments and healthcare systems by providing more robust sound event detection capabilities, which are crucial for automating monitoring tasks.

new_terms.normalized sound event bounding boxes (n: **Normalized Sound Event Bounding Boxes (nSEBBs)** is a post-processing method that dynamically adjusts detection boundaries for sound events, enhancing the accuracy of event localization.
